unihtee 0.0.0.9000

    • Using `unihtee`

    Uncentered Efficient Influence Function Computer

    uncentered_eif.Rd

    uncentered_eif() computes thei efficient influence function for the chosen parameter using the already estimated nuisance parameters. If certain nuisance parameters are known, such as propensity scores in a randomized control trial, then they may be input directly into this function.

    uncentered_eif(
  data,
  effect,
  confounders,
  exposure,
  outcome,
  modifiers,
  prop_score_fit,
  prop_score_values,
  cond_outcome_fit,
  failure_hazard_fit,
  censoring_hazard_fit
)

    Arguments

    data

    A data.table containing the observed data. train_data is formatted by unihtee().

    effect

    A character indicating the type of treatment effect modifier variable importance parameter. Currently supports "absolute" and "relative".

    confounders

    A character vector of column names corresponding to baseline covariates.

    exposure

    A character corresponding to the exposure variable.

    outcome

    A character corresponding to the outcome variable.

    modifiers

    A character vector of columns names corresponding to the suspected effect modifiers. This vector must be a subset of confounders.

    prop_score_fit

    A list output by the fit_prop_score() function.

    prop_score_values

    A numeric vector corresponding to the (known) propensity score values for each observation in data.

    cond_outcome_fit

    A list output by the fit_failure_hazard() function.'

    failure_hazard_fit

    A list output by the fit_cond_outcome() function.'

    censoring_hazard_fit

    A list output by the fit_censoring_hazard() function.'

    Value

    A data.table whose columns are the uncentered efficient influence functions of each variable in modifiers. The rows correspond to the observations of data.

    Contents

    Developed by Philippe Boileau.
